sentence.Network_en: She became uncooperative: unwilling to do her homework or help with any household chores.

entry.def: If you describe someone as uncooperative, you mean that they make no effort at all to help other people or to make other people's lives easier.

example.ex: She became uncooperative: unwilling to do her homework or help with any household chores.
example.tran: 她变得很不合作：不愿做作业，也不愿帮着做家务。

example.ex: ...a bunch of stupid, cranky, uncooperative old fools.
example.tran: 一群老朽愚昧、乖戾不合作的蠢货

sentences.sentence: "the action was not offensive to him but proved somewhat disobliging"
